error_description: Raw SQL concatenation in getByUsername enables SQL injection vulnerability (Security: injection), allowing arbitrary database access and data exfiltration via malicious username parameters.
NullPointerException risk in checkLogin when userRepository.findByUsername returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), causing application crash on non-existent username login attempts.
NullPointerException in getById when addressRepository.findById returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), crashing the application without proper error handling.
NullPointerException in update when addressRepository.findById returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), leading to application crash during address updates.
NullPointerException in delete when addressRepository.findById returns empty Optional (Reliability: fault tolerance), causing crash during address deletion operations.
Mismatched validation field name 'someValue' instead of 'street' (Functional suitability: correctness), causing validation bypass and data integrity issues in address creation.
Mapper incorrectly maps 'someValue' to 'street' (Functional suitability: correctness), resulting in lost or corrupted street address data during entity-DTO conversion.
Update mapper incorrectly maps 'someValue' to 'street' (Functional suitability: correctness), leading to data corruption in partial address updates.
Hardcoded dummy hash exposes timing attack surface despite comment (Security: resistance), potentially enabling username enumeration via response time differences.
Redundant BCryptPasswordEncoder instantiation in save (Performance: time behaviour), causing unnecessary CPU overhead and reduced throughput under load.
Redundant BCryptPasswordEncoder instantiation in update (Performance: time behaviour), creating avoidable performance degradation in user update operations.
Inconsistent password encoder usage violates DRY principle (Maintainability: modularity), risking future inconsistencies if encoder configuration changes.
Missing @PreAuthorize on delete endpoint enables unauthorized user deletion (Security: access control), allowing any authenticated user to delete any account.
Non-descriptive method name 'do_Some_Stuff' violates Clean Code naming principles (Maintainability: analysability), reducing code readability and comprehension.
Unnecessary @Autowired on field injection for UserRepository (Maintainability: modularity), promoting hidden dependencies and violating explicit constructor injection best practices.
Constructor uses @Autowired annotation unnecessarily (Maintainability: modularity), as Spring Boot auto-wires by type; this adds redundant noise to the code.
